Transaction Time for Buying ETH (Ethereum) at CoinUnit ATM in Hong Kong

Since you clarified “no eth” but the context suggests you likely meant ETH (Ethereum) instead of ETC (Ethereum Classic) from the previous query, I’ll provide the estimated time for purchasing ETH using a CoinUnit (CoinUnited.io) ATM in Hong Kong, based on available information and general crypto ATM operations as of October 2025.

Overall Process Time:

  • End-to-End (Cash to Wallet Receipt): Typically 3-10 minutes.
    • ATM Interaction: 1-2 minutes – Scan your Ethereum wallet QR code, insert cash (HKD), confirm the rate, and receive a transaction ID/receipt.
    • Crypto Dispatch: Near-instant to 3 minutes – CoinUnit ATMs, powered by General Bytes, process transactions quickly, sending ETH to your wallet address after cash verification.
    • First Confirmation: 1-5 minutes on average – Ethereum’s blockchain has block times of ~12-15 seconds, so under normal conditions, you’ll see the ETH in your wallet as “confirmed” within a few minutes.

Key Factors Affecting Time:

  • Network Congestion: Ethereum’s blockchain is generally fast, but during high traffic (e.g., heavy DeFi activity), confirmations might take 5-10 minutes. Check real-time network status on explorers like etherscan.io for gas fees and confirmation times.
  • Transaction Size and KYC: Smaller transactions (e.g., < HKD 10,000) typically require minimal or no ID verification, keeping the process under 5 minutes. Larger amounts may need ID scans, adding 1-2 minutes.
  • Wallet Setup: Use a compatible ETH wallet (e.g., MetaMask, Trust Wallet, or Coinbase Wallet) with a scannable QR code for quick input. Ensure your wallet is set up to receive ETH to avoid delays.

User Experience and Comparisons:

  • CoinUnit ATMs are noted for speed and user-friendliness, with reviews calling transactions “fast” and “seamless.” ETH, alongside BTC and USDT, is a core offering, benefiting from their reliable General Bytes hardware.
  • Compared to competitors like Localcoin or HK Bitcoin ATM, CoinUnit’s ETH purchase process is similarly efficient, often faster than BTC due to Ethereum’s quicker block times.
  • No widespread reports of delays or issues with CoinUnit ATMs for ETH specifically, based on available feedback.

Recommendations:

  • Start Small: Test with a small transaction to confirm the process and wallet compatibility.
  • Monitor Network: Use a blockchain explorer like Etherscan to track your transaction if it doesn’t appear within 10 minutes.
  • Contact Support: If ETH doesn’t show up within 15-20 minutes, contact CoinUnit’s 24/7 support via coinunit.io with your transaction ID.
